Bug 746824: minor fixes

Bug 733994: Enable mirror lists for all installed repos; r=bear

This sets up a mirror list for each repo, with the first item being the
"local" repository (the one on the puppet master), and the remainder
being all of the other puppet masters.
Bug 736255: point at correct location for the base centos repo; r=bear

Bug 746341: use gpgcheck=1 for epel, centos repos; r=bear

This applies both at system install time, and once puppet is up and
running.

This adds a erb-based template system to setup/, since there's a lot of
code duplication there.

Bug 733545: refactor sudoers

This allows new sudoers files to be added and specified only for certain
toplevel types.  With this setup, all hosts will get a sudoers config,
but only slaves will allow the builder_user to reboot them.  This also
abstracts cltbld into builder_user in the reboot rule.

Bug 733545: add NRPE support

This contains all expected checks for build slaves, and most of them for
masters, although the mysql check will not work as it does not have the
correct secrets.  Since we're not building masters yet, this is OK.
Bug 754881: Use the correct version of distribute and --never-download in python::virtualenv r=me p=jwatkins
Bug 757997: make puppetize.sh useable interactively, and keep it up to date

Bug 733110: puppet::atboot uses all puppet masters; r=kmoir

This adds the full list of masters to default-config.csv, and unpacks
that into /etc/puppet/puppetmasters.txt, which is then used by the
initscript.

Bug 757283: install ~/.pip/pip.conf for root and the builder; r=kmoir

Sadly, pip does not consult e.g., /etc/pip.conf, so we'll need to do
this for every role user.

Note that this also refactors the python::virtualenv code to use the
mirror list.

Bug 758842: refactor packages::mozilla-tools into individual packages; r=kmoir

* The .spec files are mostly from https://github.com/jhford/releng-rpms.
* Note that I switched to using regexps for the nodes list, rather than
  the lengthy listing in there before.
* The mock and createrepo packages are not part of the build process and
  not required on slaves.
* The added exec replaces mock_mozilla-add, and
  mock-add is not required since mock is not installed.
* /etc/mock_mozilla/mozilla-f11-i386.cfg is unused.

Bug 738040: replace custom PATH with links in /usr/local/bin; r=kmoir

This upgrades some RPMs:
    git.spec - links added
    mock_mozilla.spec - not in /tools
    py27_mercurial.spec - links added
    py27_virtualenv.spec - links added
    python26.spec - links added
    python27.spec - links added
    tooltool.pp - no package
and adds /usr/local/bin to PATH only for the builder user.  It
specifically removes the global PATH-setting file.

(I went ahead and added the links in python26, as it was the only unused
package - I'm sorry to change my mind so much!)

Note that this does *not* add a 'python' link, so with or without this
patch, a bare 'python' will run the system python (2.6.6).

Bug 776641: Manage root and builder on OS X 10.8, take 2; r=kmoir

This splits account creation into child classes, both for clarity and
to allow them to be require'd by class name rather than by User[..].

This updates the darwinuser provider to the latest from glarizza:
  https://github.com/glarizza/puppet-1/commit/84621993be1b16e26fdf885d1a7315bb47fc9e6c

It adds the secrets and whatnot required to supply passwords for 10.8.

It deletes the 'administrator' account, which is an artifact of how we
set up these systems, but it can't hurt to ensure => absent.

This does *not* add the builder user to the Administrators group.  By
default, only Administrators are allowed to SSH to a machine, so the
builder user will not be permitted.  The sshd module in bug 764948 will
take care of this.

Finally, this adds setup/mtnlion-user-info.rb, for getting the password,
salt, and iterations values for existing users.

Bug 779097: add anchors to users:*

This adds anchors so that the action of users::xx is completely
encapsulated by Class['users::xx'] in a require or before statement.

Actually, that's not quite true.  The user accounts themselves are
created in a new 'users' stage that runs before 'main'.  This avoids
problems where the automatic user dependency doesn't work (e.g., the
temporary darwinuser type).

Bug 869542: Add aspects, secret(); r=rail, f=Callek

The new secret() function looks up a named secret.

Aspects cross-cut the concerns represented by the toplevel hierarchy.
The only currently-defined aspect is "staging", but others will be added
in the future.  The secret() function supports aspects automatically,
looking up secrets by `{name}!{aspect}` before defaulting to `{name}`,
allowing secrets to be altered by aspects easiliy, without special
handling in the modules using the secrets.
condition mozpool config on staging aspect, not deprecated variable; a=bustage

Bug 838183: add support for accounts for real people; r=rail

 * replaces $global_authorized_keys with $admin_users, which are people with admin rights:
   * ssh keys in root's authorized_keys
   * ssh keys in builder's authorized_keys
   * user accounts on all servers
   * unfettered sudo access
 * There's also $users, which just gets you a user account
 * Allows user accounts to ship with dotfiles; mine used as an example
 * Supports multiple SSH keys per person
 * Includes accounts and SSH keys for all releng + moco admins
   (I have a script to sync this from LDAP, but it won't end up in the repo)
 * Purges un-managed users
 * Archives the homedirs of nonexistent users (script by :kang)
 * Tested on Darwin, too, although we're not currently running servers on Darwin

Bug 838183: support extra keys for builder, root; use for release-runner; r=rail

  * http://projects.puppetlabs.com/issues/22107

This is a re-landing, with environment_timeout changed from 10s to 600s
on the hypothesis that the short timeout was behind the performance
issues.

Note that this makes existing user environments invalid, as they are
located at /etc/puppet/environments/$user/env/, and the "env/" suffix
is not compatible with directory environments.

Bug 1055793 - Ensures that runner.plist is absent from OSX hosts

In the event that a change to runner requires a rollback, this will prevent the runner launchd config
from causing problems.

Bug 1055793 - Use runner on OS X; r=dustin

Installs runner along with a launchd init config which runs runner as the cltbld user.
Runner had previously assumed it would be run as root, by init.d/upstart, and
had opted to use 'su -' prior to starting the buildslave. Because starting
runner as cltbld is possible, and desirable for the resulting environment,
the Linux approach fails as it produces a user environment with no display and an incomplete path.
To fix this the runner buildbot task's template was modified to allow custom
buildslave commands to be set via puppet variables.

Bug 1252624 - Remove region pinning from bundleclone preferences; r=rail

As of bug 1249197, the bundleclone and clonebundles manifests served by
hg.mozilla.org automatically take the client's IP address into
consideration and serve up appropriate URLs. For clients in AWS regions
us-west-1, us-west-2, and us-east-1 (regions where we're currently
writing bundles to), they will automatically connect to and download
from the local AWS region. All other IPs will be advertised the CDN
and fall back to us-west-2 if they don't support SNI.

This server-side IP filtering should make the client-side preferences
no longer necessary.

This commit removes the region pinning from the hgrc and mercurial.ini
templates. The config_hgrc module has been removed because it was only
adding regions to the config and this is no longer necessary.

MozReview-Commit-ID: I1dKoVh33vN

bug 1421124 - create a new python27 module. r=callek

We're creating a new module here so we don't upgrade the world. Instead, each module can point at the python27 module when they're ready.

This patch is intended to upgrade virtualenv and pip from our ancient pip 1.5.5 to virtualenv 15.0.2 + pip 8.1.2. I chose this version because virtualenv 15.1.0 includes pip 9.0.1; pip 9.x requires SSL; and our puppet servers don't have valid SSL certs. pip 8.1.2 allows for --trusted-host which allows us to fix the puppet bustage in this bug, but avoids requiring new SSL certs on the puppet servers.

MozReview-Commit-ID: HYBlKclDoQq

bug 1440287 - 1yr artifact expiration for production scriptworkers. r=jlorenzo

Currently we're expiring our scriptworker artifacts after 2 weeks. This is acceptable for our dev and dep pools, but for our releases we'd like to keep logs for ~1yr. This patch adds `artifact_expiration_hours` settings and passes it to the scriptworker instance module. I also had to update teh whitespace since `artifact_expiration_hours` is one character longer than all the other keys, and puppet linting complains.

Bump signcode maxsize to 350MB. (#128)

use fqdn for ssl cert definition

The self-signed ssl certs are fqdn-specific, so it doesn't make a
lot of sense to allow for them to cross domains based on shared
hostname.

Also, `hiera_hash` appears to reference the global hiera secrets and
doesn't respect environments. Switching to `secret` instead appears to
work and also respect the environment.

This change assumes we're going to switch over the secrets at the same
time we land this patch set. If we want a more gradual change over, we
may want to introduce a new set of secrets (e.g.,
`signing_server_ssl_cert_new` ?) that can coexist with the old secrets.

Doc secops interest in the signcode_maxsize value

The fx-sig-verify tool also sets a maxsize. Keeping the two values in
sync avoids pages.
